issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Facet should say Amazon, but you can use the owner account ID behind the scenes for making the match.
fields.summary: need to support owner = Amazon search facet when connected to AWS

comments.body: What is the correct way to tell if we are in "AWS mode"?
What is the owner account ID for amazon?
[~dkavanagh], do you know the answer for Ean?  Jenny's out.

I mentioned this during the scrum, but the account ID can be found in the default security group owner field. That's how we do it for euca and that works for AWS as well. That group will always be there, so we can count on that value.
This sets the default search to "owner: amazon" when logged in to AWS.
facet says OWNERID instead of owner. sad trombones. See attached file.
[~eans]: Which pull request or branch includes this fix?
The owner = amazon facet works on testing branch but breaks with https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/141

When I switch to the 7504 branch, the Images page post aws login takes about a minute to load with owner:amazon. Switching back to the testing branch with ownerid: amazon, the images load in 1-2 seconds. 

[~eans] or [~dkavanagh] I'm inclined to not merge this branch unless we can fix the discrepancy.

/cc [~jloza]

[~jloza]: Looking at the date of this bug, I'm not sure it's still valid since the issue appears to have been fixed some time ago.  Unless all we're hoping to do is the change the label of the facet from ownerid:amazon to owner:amazon? If that's the case, I don't think PR 141 should be merged since it appears to cause a major regression in the load times of the Images page.

When owner:amazon is set it definitely waits until the fetch for allimages is completed before displaying in chrome. The bug, to me, is that allimages is even being loaded in this case. You are trying to look at amazonimages, not allimages. Its informative to watch the "network" view in Chrome's developer tools while you are waiting for the console to respond, you can see exactly what it is delayed by. 


----- "Kamal Gill (JIRA)" wrote: 

-- 
Ean Schuessler, CTO 
ean@brainfood.com 
214-720-0700 x 315 
Brainfood, Inc. 
http://www.brainfood.com

[~kgill], This was the original request. When verifying this, I saw OWNERID in the user-facing text instead of OWNER which should be fixed as it is not correct and in fact is explicitly stated in the description of this issue. I don't care what the code uses to do the matching behind the scenes, but what the user sees should say OWNER: AMAZON
And this was definitely *not* working in the QA system today with the latest console packages. See attached screenshot.
Verified in latest build that default filter is now Amazon owned images.
